intro: Collomia eritrichoides, commonly known as the Sierra primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its showy, yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, often in open meadows and slopes. It has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy, and its stems are usually unbranched. Collomia eritrichoides is a member of the Boraginaceae family, known for its medicinal and ornamental value.
